Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First lets recall the standard Hire-to-Retire process sequence Typically it goes like this Post Job Ad Screen Candidates Conduct Interviews Make Hiring Decision Onboard Employee Add to Payroll Close Case Thats the expected sequence

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now looking at Model 1 Model 1 is defined as a StrictPartialOrder with nodes Post Screen Decide Interview Onboard Payroll Close The order relations are Post Screen Screen Decide Screen Interview Decide Onboard Onboard Payroll Payroll Close Hmm the standard sequence is Post Screen Interview Decide Onboard Payroll Close But here Screen has edges to both Decide and Interview So after screening you can go directly to making a decision or to conducting interviews That seems odd because typically youd screen candidates then interview the shortlisted ones then make a decision So having Screen Decide means you could make a hiring decision without conducting interviews Thats an anomaly But also Screen Interview is there so you could do interviews after screening which is correct But the problem is that Decide comes after Screen but Interview is also after Screen but theres no relation between Interview and Decide Wait in the standard process Interview should come before Decide But here Screen Decide and Screen Interview but no edge from Interview to Decide So Decide could happen before Interview Wait no the edges are Screen Decide and Screen Interview but no edge between Interview and Decide So in a partial order that means Decide and Interview could be in any order relative to each other as long as both are after Screen But thats a problem because you should conduct interviews before making a hiring decision So the anomaly here is that MakeHiringDecision Decide could occur before ConductInterviews Interview which doesnt make sense Normally you interview first then decide Also in Model 1 theres no constraint between Interview and Decide So its possible to have Decide before Interview which is illogical Thats a clear anomaly

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now comparing both models Model 1 anomalies 1 Screen Decide and Screen Interview with no relation between Interview and Decide so Decide could happen before Interview 2 Also in Model 1 theres no edge from Interview to Decide so Interview and Decide are not ordered relative to each other which is wrong Model 2 anomalies 1 Post Interview can interview before screening 2 looponboarding onboarding can be done multiple times which is odd 3 xorpayroll can skip adding to payroll which is critical

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Which model is more aligned with the normative process Model 1 has the issue that Decide could come before Interview but at least all activities are present and must be done no skipping In Model 2 you can skip payroll which is a major issue and you can interview before screening But in Model 1 the sequence could be Post Screen Decide Onboard Payroll Close skipping Interview entirely Wait no because Screen Interview is also an edge but in a partial order if theres no direct edge requiring Interview to happen could Interview be skipped Wait in Model 1 the nodes are Post Screen Decide Interview Onboard Payroll Close The edges are PostScreen ScreenDecide ScreenInterview DecideOnboard etc So Screen has edges to both Decide and Interview But theres no edge from Interview to Decide or vice versa So in the partial order Interview and Decide are both after Screen but their order relative to each other is not specified That means its possible to have Screen Decide without doing Interview or Screen Interview Decide or Screen Decide Interview but that wouldnt make sense logically but the model allows it because theres no constraint But the problem is that the model allows for Decide before Interview which is an anomaly

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: But wait in Model 1 can you have a sequence where Interview is not done No because all nodes must be executed in a strict partial order So Interview must happen but it could be after Decide For Model 2 Anomaly Post Interview allows Interview before Screen Anomaly looponboarding allows multiple onboardings which is odd Anomaly xorpayroll allows skipping Payroll which is critical So Model 2 has three anomalies one of which is severe skipping payroll while Model 1 has one anomaly possible Decide before Interview
